summary: The Women and Underrepresented Minorities in STEM Booster Act of 2025 aims to increase participation of underrepresented groups (women, minorities, persons with disabilities, and LGBTQ+) in STEM fields. The bill authorizes the National Science Foundation to award grants for programs like online workshops, mentoring, internships, and outreach, designed to promote STEM education and employment. It highlights disparities in STEM representation and retention across various demographics, and authorizes $15 million annually for program funding from 2026-2030.
